prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Square Cutouts The first part is a rectangular prism with square cutouts on each side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Now, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1). The loop will be composed of the following lines and arcs: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.4375, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.4375, 0.0], End Point [0.4375, 0.125] * Line 3: Start Point [0.4375, 0.125], End Point [0.3125, 0.125] * Line 4: Start Point [0.3125, 0.125], End Point [0.3125, 0.4375] * Line 5: Start Point [0.3125, 0.4375], End Point [0.4375, 0.4375] * Line 6: Start Point [0.4375, 0.4375], End Point [0.4375, 0.5625] * Line 7: Start Point [0.4375, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.5625] * Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.4375] * Line 9: Start Point [0.0, 0.4375], End Point [0.125, 0.4375] * Line 10: Start Point [0.125, 0.4375], End Point [0.125, 0.125] * Line 11: Start Point [0.125, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] * Line 12: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Each loop is made up of 12 lines forming a single face representing the rectangular prism with square cutouts. Note the specific start and end points for each line, as they are crucial for creating an accurate CAD model. After creating the 2D sketch, scale the sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5625 (sketch\\_scale). Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system defined earlier. Finally, extrude the sketch along the normal, creating a 3D model with a depth of 0.375. The final part dimensions are: * Length: 0.5625 * Width: 0.375 * Height: 0.5625 The result is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a square base and four rectangular sides, each with a square cutout. The top and bottom faces are flat and parallel to each other. The sides are perpendicular to the base and parallel to each other. The cutouts are centered on the sides and are the same size as the sides. The model is symmetrical along the center axis.</description>
